title: Property of dissolved company to be bona vacantia.
content: 328. Where a company is dissolved, all property and rights whatsoever vested in or held on trust for the company immediately before its dissolution (not including property held by the company on trust for any other person) shall, subject and without prejudice to any order which may at any time be made by the Court under sections 326 and 327 be deemed to be bona vacantia and shall accordingly belong to the Republic, and shall vest and may be dealt with in the same manner as other bona vacantia accruing to the Republic. Power of the Republic to disclaim title to property vesting under section 328.
